intro: Vangueriopsis lanciflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved vangueriopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
